newsitem.title: USA: American Homestar says to buy N.C. Mobile.
newsitem.headline: American Homestar says to buy N.C. Mobile.

text.p: American Homestar Corp said Wednesday it agreed to acquire privately owned retailer N.C. Mobile Home Corp for about $4.5 million in stock and cash.

The company said the deal is scheduled to close on June 1, and includes payment of $2.0 million in American Homestar's common stock and $2.5 million in cash and notes. The transaction will be accounted for as a purchase and is expected to be nominally accretive to fiscal 1998 earnings.

"When added to our existing retail franchise system and the non-affiliated independent dealers we serve, these new company retail centers will afford us a broader and more solid distribution base from which we can continue to implement our vertical integration growth strategy in this important market region," said co-chief executives Finis Teeter and Laurence Dawson.
American Homestar currently operates eight manufacturing plants, 52 company-owned retail centers, and serves more than 300 independent retail locations in 24 states.
The company recently announced the planned acquisition of Brilliant Homes in Alabama which, when completed in June 1997, will add three new manufacturing plants to the Company's network.
